categories.title: Hyperfy Platform and 'Fallen' Game Development Summary

content.text: The Hyperfy platform is undergoing significant technical development, with a focus on modularity, user onboarding, and AI integration. A persistent, app-based inventory system has been implemented by drdoge.eth, with plans to split it into two modular apps. Hyperfy now supports permanent world storage without strict file size limits, ideal for metadata and stats. Multi-tenant world support is enabled via URL parameters, allowing scene switching through world folders.

Dynamic asset loading is supported through world.load(), enabling models and avatars to be fetched from external sources like Arweave and IPFS. To address CORS issues, a Node.js proxy endpoint is recommended. An experimental wind shader is available, activated via a custom Blender property, though it currently lacks adjustable parameters.

AI integration is a major focus, with users like 0mka_ building AI-enhanced UI mods. There is consensus that AI should be a core part of the IDE, especially to assist non-coders. Voice chat has been internally implemented, with future plans for screen sharing and in-world town halls. Discussions continue on whether to move common app features into the Hyperfy core, balancing flexibility with usability.

User experience (UX) remains a key differentiator for Hyperfy. Community members emphasized the need for better onboarding, templates, and examples to reduce friction for new users. Feature requests include drag-and-drop worldbuilding, Git integration, and a monetizable gizmo marketplace.

The 'Fallen' game, built on Hyperfy, is progressing with a functional core loop and community-driven iteration. A safe zone mechanic teleports players without a wallet or token balance back to the lobby. Tokenized gameplay is being explored, including a parkour game with $HYPER token chests and a 1v1 staking arena inspired by RuneScape.

Wallet integration is in progress, with app events abstracting payment flows. PvE/PvP hybrid modes and NFT-based rewards are under discussion. The engine supports AI-generated maps, and a performant grass particle system with wind animation has been developed by gertjanakerboom.

Lore and ecosystem development are community priorities. Suggestions include lore competitions, canonized items, and overworlds linking multiple game instances. NFT integration for skins, rewards, and marketplace trading is also being explored, with support for creator royalties.
The current price of SOL (Solana) is $105.84.
